title_full:
Ciro Vitiello

              —
              The Island Of Bouncy Memories
            
              (Haunter Records / Haunter / Hundebiss)
label: Haunter Records / Haunter / Hundebiss
description:
Poetic and romantically surreal, Ciro Vitiello's debut is a meditation on nostalgia and adulthood that threads quirky vocals through tender, enigmatic soundscapes, repeating themes and phrases until they turn into half-remembered dreams.

'The Island of Bouncy Memories' is Vitiello's attempt to map his dreamworld, based on initial sketches he made using his collection of childhood toys. These ideas were eventually fleshed out, and braided with vocals from Zimmy and Rose Greenfield... more

title_full:
TOLOUSE LOW TRAX

              —
              Kiosque Versions
            
              (Bureau B)
label: Bureau B
description:
Maverick beat shifters, Simo Cell, Grim Lusk, Joakim, Ido Plumes, Froid Dub, and Beat Detectives rework Tolouse Low Trax idiosyncrasies in their own image.

‘Kiosque Versions’ has nowt to do with Tolouse Low Trax’s ‘Kiosque of Arrows’ compilation of other artists, but does take its cues from a wealth of offbeat solo works conjured by the erstwhile Salon des Amateurs and current Parisian resident. It finds a decade of his irregular grooves chopped up and reframed with equal measures of... more

label: TraTraTrax Records
description:
Brooklyn’s Doctor Jeep gets the blood going, Raptor house style, on a return to Colombia’s leading label, teamed with superb remixes by Ploy, Wata Igarashi, and Peder Mannerfelt 

Everyone goes hard on the peak time club brief inside ‘Mecha’. Just over 10 years since their debut, and a year after the ‘Push The Body’ EP’, dancefloor medic Doctor Jeep turns out the title tune’s gnashingly brisk, squeaky dembow rave beside the reckless momentum of ‘Pika 2’ and a mean sort of psy-trance-ton... more

release: Hot Springs (Ft Ezra Fieremans) - from Various - Venus Rising From The Sea (Doyenne)
title_full:
Christina Vantzou

            —
            Hot Springs (Ft Ezra Fieremans) - from Various - Venus Rising From The Sea (Doyenne)

label: Scenic Route Records
description:
Gorgeous debut of discrete dream-pop by classically trained singer-songwriter Vanessa Bedoret, a timeless bouquet of raptures and ballads iced with shearing strings and shatterproof electronics - one for fans of Wild Adoration, Seefeel, Oï les Ox, Flora Yin Wong.

Presented by London’s Scenic Route, ‘Eyes’ represents Vanessa Bedoret’s first fully fledged solo record after tentative starts with James Marrs and Fat White Family’s Severin Black since 2020. She arrives pretty much fully formed from a... more

label: Subtext
description:
ZULI slows the tempo and widens the aspect ratio on his Subtext debut, chopping hoarse trip-hop and industrial vignettes with gloopy, fractal ambience and, most surprisingly, future-facing electroid pop. Featuring guest appearances from Coby Sey, MICHAELBRAILEY and Abdullah Miniawy, 'Lambda' is crucial listening if you're into Lee Gamble, Aïsha Devi, Piotr Kurek or Ziúr. 

Last time we heard from ZULI, he was tearing through the remnants of the grid on 'Digla Dive - Live', showing just... more

title_full:
DJ FLG

            —
            vo hu vo hu

label: Horn Of Plenty
description:
Oh this is gorgeous; Warm Currency shimmer thru the folk mantle on 'Petals', returning to the excellent Horn of Plenty imprint with an intimate volume of soul-piercing preternatural spells that sublime dazed poetics, radio noise and found sounds in a mode that feels like a more autumnal, downcast companion to Jonnine’s ‘Southside Girl’ album from earlier this year, as well as those incredible Empress records no one ever seems to talk about anymore.

Matthew P. Hopkins and Mary... more
